quotes.text: You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work. You should never engage in action for the sake of reward, nor should you long for inaction.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die. It is not that having come into existence, it will again cease to be. It is unborn, eternal, changeless, ever-one. It is not slain when the body is slain.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Whenever dharma declines and the purpose of life is forgotten, I manifest myself on earth. I am born in every age to protect the good, to destroy evil, and to reestablish dharma.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: There is neither this world, nor the world beyond, nor happiness for the one who doubts.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: From anger comes delusion; from delusion, confused memory; from confused memory the destruction of reason; from destruction of reason, one perishes.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: The mind is restless, turbulent, obstinate and very strong. To subdue it is more difficult than controlling the wind, but it is possible by constant practice and by detachment.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among men.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: The power of God is with you at all times; through the activities of mind, senses, breathing, and emotions; and is constantly doing all the work using you as a mere instrument.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Whatever happened, happened for the good. Whatever is happening, is happening for the good. Whatever will happen, will also happen for the good.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Change is the law of the universe. You can be a millionaire, or a pauper in an instant.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: The self-controlled soul, who moves amongst sense objects, free from either attachment or repulsion, he wins eternal Peace.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: A gift is pure when it is given from the heart to the right person at the right time and at the right place, and when we expect nothing in return.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Fear not what is not real, never was and never will be. What is real, always was and cannot be destroyed.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: There are three gates to self-destruction and hell: Lust, Anger, and Greed.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Man is made by his belief. As he believes, so he is.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: He who has no attachments can really love others, for his love is pure and divine.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Perform your obligatory duty, because action is indeed better than inaction.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: A person can rise through the efforts of his own mind; he can also degrade himself. The mind is the friend of the conditioned soul, and his enemy as well.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: The meaning of Karma is in the intention. The intention behind action is what matters.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: No one who does good work will ever come to a bad end, either here or in the world to come.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.text: Truth is one, the wise call it by different names.
quotes.author: Rig Veda

quotes.text: Let noble thoughts come to us from every side.
quotes.author: Rig Veda

quotes.text: As is the human body, so is the cosmic body. As is the human mind, so is the cosmic mind. As is the microcosm, so is the macrocosm.
quotes.author: Yajur Veda

quotes.text: The one who loves all intensely begins perceiving in all living beings a part of himself.
quotes.author: Yajur Veda

quotes.text: From the unreal lead me to the real, from darkness lead me to light, from death lead me to immortality.
quotes.author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad

quotes.text: You are what your deep, driving desire is. As your desire is, so is your will. As your will is, so is your deed. As your deed is, so is your destiny.
quotes.author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad

quotes.text: Aham Brahmasmi - I am the infinite reality.
quotes.author: Brihadaranyaka Upanishad

quotes.text: Tat Tvam Asi - Thou art That.
quotes.author: Chandogya Upanishad

quotes.text: When the five senses and the mind are still, and the reasoning intellect rests in silence, then begins the highest path.
quotes.author: Katha Upanishad

quotes.text: Dharma is that which upholds, supports or maintains the regulatory order of the universe.
quotes.author: Mahabharata

quotes.text: Ahimsa Paramo Dharma - Non-violence is the highest dharma.
quotes.author: Mahabharata

quotes.text: There is no eye equal to knowledge, no austerity equal to truth, no pain equal to attachment, and no happiness equal to renunciation.
quotes.author: Mahabharata

quotes.text: Righteousness is the foundation of the entire universe. A righteous man is considered the best in the world.
quotes.author: Valmiki

quotes.text: There is no greater virtue than the protection of the weak and the service of the righteous.
quotes.author: Lord Rama

quotes.text: Even the mightiest mountain can be moved by persistent effort and unwavering faith.
quotes.author: Lord Hanuman
